descript.abstract:
This the Metropolitan Planning Organization (MPO) area for the Twin Cities. The shape covers the 7 county area as well as the urbanized area that extends beyond the 7 county area.
Under state law, the Met Council's jurisdiction covers the 7 county area - Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott, and Washington counties.
Under federal rules, the MPO must plan for the entire urbanized area, which is a Census defined area. After the 2010 Census, the urbanized area for the Twin Cities extended beyond the 7 county area into Wright and Sherburne counties.
Thus, for the first time, the MPO jurisdiction area for the Met Council needed to extend beyond the 7 counties.
Working with MnDOT, the census defined urbanized area was smoothed and this data file was the officially accepted MPO area for the Twin Cities.
descript.purpose: To delineate the extent of the Metropolitan Planning Organization Area
descript.supplinf: Twin Cities 7 County Area (Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington) and the urbanized portions of urbanized portions of Wright and Sherburne Counties

place.placekey: Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County

theme.themekey: MPO, planning, urbanized area, UZA, TMA, census

attracc.attraccr: This is regional planning level data and is not intended to be used for anything but regional planning. Some alignments may have been shifted for cartographic display purposes.

dataqual.complete: Entire seven county geographic area and portains of Wright and Sherburne counties

procstep.procdesc: This data area combination of US Census urbanized area files and county boundaries. Small changes were approved by MnDOT and the Met Council.

spdoinfo.mgmg3til: One layer for entire seven county region.
